ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to speak in Chinese about social, political, and cultural issues.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: interesting, useful, engaging, very understanding professors
Weaknesses: sometimes the homework is redundant, but overall not that bad

I thought the structure and workload of this course were excellent. Going through the entire text and grammar structures during class was very helpful in memorizing the content. I felt like the assignments were all beneficial towards my learning. However, I would have liked to have done more of the partner work in class--this was a great way to practice conversational Chinese.

Absolutely wonderful course! Great and dynamic discussions, with grammar and vocab weaved in very nicely. If I could change anything, it would be to not have approximately weekly character phrase writing quizzes, or maybe to have fewer phrases on them, or even a quiz that checks understanding rather than hand writing because studying for those was very time consuming and I felt that my time could be better spent in other ways practicing Chinese.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. My Chinese improved a lot this term.

Absolutely! The instructors and TAs are excellent. The course is very well structured so it is easy to stay organized with assignments. Most importantly, L5 is great because you get more practice with conversational Chinese while also learning about the cultural issues affecting modern China.
Absolutely! Great practice with Chinese and in my experience wonderful classmates and teachers!
